definition: to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: A man and a child were found in the Cave-in produce truck.
sentences.chinese: 一名男子和一名兒童在一輛撞毀的農用卡車上被發現。

sentences.english: Some said it had been driven to destruction on the coast of Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 有人說勝利號是在愛爾蘭海岸邊被撞毀的。

sentences.english: He"s likely to be bumped out of a job from a senior worker from the Millinocket mill."
sentences.chinese: 他可能被撞毀的工作由一名高級工人從米利諾基特廠。

sentences.english: Out of control, the plane slammed into the woods northeast of Paris.
sentences.chinese: 飛機在失去控制後撞毀在巴黎東北的森林中。

sentences.english: The cause of the aircraft crash is so far unknown.
sentences.chinese: 尚不知飛機撞毀的原因。

sentences.english: And at other times, Neptunes has you crashing into brick walls and running down dead ends.
sentences.chinese: 而在其他時間，海王星撞毀了你磚牆和運行了死角。

sentences.english: We are always interested in buying your SAAB Dead or Alive accident damaged etc.
sentences.chinese: 我們亦有興趣收購任何紳寶汽車，不論好壞或撞毀。

sentences.english: The wrecked car had to be lifted before the driver could be extricated.
sentences.chinese: 必須把那輛撞毀的車子移開後才能救出司機。

sentences.english: Planes and helicopters and cars and birds crash into it.
sentences.chinese: 飛機，直升機，汽車和鳥類撞毀在這裏。

sentences.english: The aircraft was smashed and they stepped out onto the open desert.
sentences.chinese: 飛機撞毀，他們步出飛機，站在空曠的沙漠上。

sentences.english: Auto insurance wouldn't be necessary. You would use your diskette to recover from a crash.
sentences.chinese: 車保也省了，一隻磁碟足以把撞毀的車復原。

definition: dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Kuomintang/same as 孫中山|孙中山
to drop anchor/to break down (of a car etc)
Tsing Ma Bridge (to Hong Kong Airport)
Tuku town in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan
